title: Over-50s ready for take-off as young buy gadgets
text:
Over-50s ready for take-off as young buy gadgets Over-50s ready for take-off as young buy gadgets THE over-50s are the new jet-setters, flying high while younger travellers are left on the ground. PUBLISHED: 07:47, Wed, Jul 29, 2015 | UPDATED: 07:53, Wed, Jul 29, 2015 GETTY Travel is tempting as children start to leave home just as incomes are on the up 
Older holidaymakers now spend more than £2billion a year extra on trips than younger adults, according to new research from over-50s insurer Rias. Many are cutting back on luxury and non-essential spending to feed their travel bug while they can. 
The over-50s spend far less on nights out and new gadgets than younger people, at just £3,830 a year. Younger adults spend almost £6,000 a year on luxuries but this leaves them with less cash to travel. Many older parents are also taking advantage of the freedom and financial benefits of children flying the nest. Related articles Flirty fifties: One in six over-50s check out former flames on... 
More than half have more disposable income now that their children have left home and are seizing on their newfound freedom to jet off to distant shores. 
But Rias MD Peter Corfield warned that many older travellers are racking up large credit card bills while they are away as well as excess charges for foreign usage. The last thing you would want after all that saving is to be stung by a big credit card bill Rias MD Peter Corfield 
“The last thing you would want after all that saving is to be stung by a big credit card bill when you return home.” 
Also, older travellers with pre-existing medical conditions such as high blood pressure often struggle to find affordable travel insurance. 
Specialist travel insurers can charge four times more than mainstream insurers, according to new data from comparison site PayingTooMuch.com. Related articles
